teaser: In 2005, our very own Rico Gagliano, who was reporting for Marketplace at the time, went along with a few people for the annual SantaCon, also known as the “Santa Rampage.” “Fight Club” author Chuck Palahniuk mentioned that he took part in the annual tradition as part of the Cacophony Society, which he talks about in this […]

In 2005, our very own Rico Gagliano, who was reporting for Marketplace at the time, went along with a few people for the annual SantaCon, also known as the “Santa Rampage.” “Fight Club” author Chuck Palahniuk mentioned that he took part in the annual tradition as part of the Cacophony Society, which he talks about in this week’s Chattering Class segment on pranks.

","type":"text/html"},{"type":"text/html","content":"

contentencoded: In 2005, our very own Rico Gagliano, who was reporting for Marketplace at the time, went along with a few people for the annual SantaCon, also known as the “Santa Rampage.” “Fight Club” author Chuck Palahniuk mentioned that he took part in the annual tradition as part of the Cacophony Society, which he talks about in this week’s Chattering Class segment on pranks.
title: Revisit Rico’s SantaCon adventure
